radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Patchy ground-glass and centrilobular nodules with linear, branching (tree-in-bud) opacities predominantly affecting the upper lobe of the left lung. No lymphadenopathy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The previously seen tree-in-bud opacities in the left upper lobe had largely resolved. New subcarinal, paratracheal, and hilar lymphadenopathy was noted on a repeat scan.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Supraclavicular and mediastinal adenopathy, with the strongest signal present in the subcarinal region.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening lymphadenopathy was noted on a repeat CT scan.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Repeat CT scan of the chest
radiographic_examinations.findings: Worsening lymphadenopathy; no consolidates, opacities, or suspicious pulmonary nodules.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: New lymphadenopathy observed, which was not noted in previous imaging.
